prompt.content: Using LendingTree Inc. (ticker: TREE) 10-K for FY2024 and Damodaran data on margins of US companies by sector (as of January 2025) calculate how LendingTree adjusted EBITDA margin compare to industry-average EBITDA margin. Use as-reported aEBITDA for LendingTree. Assume the industry is Financial Svcs. (Non-bank & Insurance). Provide the absolute difference between company's FY2024 aEBITDA margin and industry average as the answer. Show the answer in % rounded to 2 decimals.

rubrics.name: FY2024 as-reported Adjusted EBITDA = $104,113 thousand ($104.113 million).

messages.content: FY2024 as-reported Adjusted EBITDA = $104,113 thousand ($104.113 million).

rubrics.name: Industry-average EBITDA margin for US-based companies in Financial Svcs. (Non-bank & Insurance) industry (Damodaran data as of Jan 2025, as required in the promt) = 18.17%.

messages.content: Industry-average EBITDA margin for US-based companies in Financial Svcs. (Non-bank & Insurance) industry (Damodaran data as of Jan 2025, as required in the promt) = 18.17%.

rubrics.name: the absolute difference between LendingTree’s FY2024 aEBITDA margin = |11.57% − 18.17%| = 6.60%.

messages.content: the absolute difference between LendingTree’s FY2024 aEBITDA margin = |11.57% − 18.17%| = 6.60%.
